description: For nearly a century, we have delivered on our commitment to saving and sustaining the lives of patients, working alongside clinicians and providers around the world. We believe every person — regardless of who they are or where they are from — deserves a chance to live a healthy life, free from illness and full of possibility. At the intersection of progress and purpose is where we are redefining what it means to be a global medtech leader. It is where we are relentlessly pursuing healthcare transformation, fueled by our compassion for patients and providers and the challenges they face. It is where bold ideas meet the promise for meaningful change in the world around us. We are there, at every step of the journey, to help clinicians deliver the best care possible.

updates.text: Everything we do is for patients like Izzy, a young cancer fighter and survivor who spent much of her treatment with a special partner by her side: her dog, Baxter. Meet Izzy and learn more about why the name 'Baxter' held a very special place in her health journey: https://bit.ly/4eydoEU #Baxter #SaveAndSustainLives

Today, the first truckloads of IV fluid products made following Hurricane Helene left our North Cove facility, while HHS Secretary Becerra and his team were onsite to survey the progress we’ve made to initiate production in phases. Our trucks are now heading to distribution points across the country to support hospitals and their patients. We're grateful for the Secretary's leadership, along with the support of teams at HHS, FDA, ASPR and the state of North Carolina. We also thank our customers, care teams and patients for their understanding and patience as we've advanced our recovery. #NorthCoveStrong

Organized by Baxter's enABLES Business Resource Group, several Baxter employees participated in the 16th Annual SkyRise Chicago event. Each of them conquered 2,149 stairs, reaching the top of Chicago's iconic Willis Tower, to raise money for the Shirley Ryan AbilityLab, the global leader in physical medicine and rehabilitation for adults and children with severe, complex conditions. #BaxterGivesBack #LifeAtBaxter

Our Advanced Surgery team hosted surgeons from Canada and Latin America at our headquarters for a surgical workshop. Keynote speaker Dr. Ryan Matthews from the UK offered invaluable insights into clinical cases and the latest techniques. Immediate action is necessary for life-threatening intraoperative bleeding. Choosing and using the right hemostatic agent correctly is vital. These collaborative and interactive sessions are where we make meaningful connections with healthcare professionals. As one participant said: "This demonstration surpassed all our expectations, filling us with a sense of pride and accomplishment."

A group of team members who work on Baxter's connected care solutions gathered for a few days of learning, collaboration and team bonding! The meeting kicked off with a visit to Baxter’s Customer Experience Center in Batesville, Indiana to see our connected care solutions in action, followed by skill-building sessions and team brainstorms at our headquarters in Deerfield, Illinois. And of course, the meeting wouldn’t be complete without a few friendly rounds of ping pong. #LifeAtBaxter

Our Alliance for Baxter Women Business Resource Group proudly helped sponsor the Race for the Cure® Brussels, organized by Think Pink Belgium. This event is Europe's largest event dedicated to women's health and plays a crucial role in supporting breast cancer organizations and hospitals. 

Baxter team members participated in the race, carrying with them those who have been affected by this disease. #ABWRaceForTheCure #LifeAtBaxter #BreastCancerAwareness

Amidst unprecedented flooding in Valencia, Spain, our colleagues banded together to keep our local warehouse facility open, provide updates to authorities and coordinate transportation to our site.

"The exceptional work of our Valencia team in the aftermath of the devastating weather conditions has been simply outstanding. We recovered the site quickly and were able, with some limitations, to continue doing our work and serve our patients. A huge thank you to the team for your commitment to our mission while going through personal losses and for all your efforts to support the community," said Ventosa Manuel, Country Lead, Spain

During our third-quarter 2024 earnings conference call with investors, CEO Joe Almeida and CFO Joel Grade discussed our positive performance and provided updates on the substantial progress we’re making in advancing hurricane recovery efforts at our North Cove, North Carolina, facility, thanks to the inspirational commitment and resilience of our Baxter team, in coordination with government agencies. bit.ly/4hGA3le

Thanks to the support of ASPR, North Carolina Department of Transportation and our local team, a second temporary bridge that will enable more truck and equipment traffic to enter and leave the site is now installed and in use. This bridge supplements the first, which has already transported more than 1,000 truckloads of finished product from the site. Latest update: https://bit.ly/3BrUWA2 #NorthCoveStrong

We're sending a huge thank you to our North Cove team for their ongoing efforts, which allowed us to restart our first IV fluids line last week. This phenomenal team and its leaders have gone above and beyond, while also navigating the storm's devastating personal and community impact. It has not been easy, and we have more hard work ahead, but we're coming back stronger than ever. Check our hurricane page for the latest information: https://lnkd.in/gPg87FNV #NorthCoveStrong
